step_by_step_thinking: The patient presents with seizures, cognitive delay, retinal calcifications, and a cardiac murmur. Tuberous Sclerosis Complex (TSC) is associated with these findings, including retinal calcifications (choroidal hamartomas), cardiac rhabdomyomas (causing murmurs), seizures, and cognitive impairment. The TSC1 gene on chromosome 9 is linked to TSC. Other options (NF1, NF2, VHL) do not align with the retinal calcifications and cardiac murmur described.
